data.title: Hopeless encryption rule
data.statement:
Encrypt the sentences, by creating a special function that will:
- consider all letters as uppercase.
- for every word, replace it with the sum of the ASCII codes of its letters, or nothing if no letters, and keep all other characters unchanged.

For example:
This sentence ==> {{Hello, boys and girls I hope that you are all fine.}}
Will be ==> {{372, 317 211 385 73 300 305 253 216 217 290.}}
Because, the first word is turned to be uppercase. Then we have {{HELLO,}} separated into {{HELLO}} and {{,}} parts.
And the sum of ASCII codes found in {{HELLO}} is {{372}}, we add here the {{,}} and we go working with the second word and so on.

Goal

Encrypt the sentences, by creating a special function that will:
- consider all letters as uppercase.
- for every word, replace it with the sum of the ASCII codes of its letters, or nothing if no letters, and keep all other characters unchanged.

For example:
This sentence ==> Hello, boys and girls I hope that you are all fine.
Will be ==> 372, 317 211 385 73 300 305 253 216 217 290.
Because, the first word is turned to be uppercase. Then we have HELLO, separated into HELLO and , parts.
And the sum of ASCII codes found in HELLO is 372, we add here the , and we go working with the second word and so on.
Input
Text given as string cleartext
Output
Encrypted version of the input text
Constraints
0 < length(cleartext) < 200
Example
Input
Hello, I HOPE that YOU are fine!
Output
372, 73 300 305 253 216 290!
